name: New Year's Day
description: Celebration of the first day of the Gregorian calendar year.

name: Guru Gobind Singh Jayanti
description: Birth anniversary of Guru Gobind Singh, the tenth Sikh Guru.

name: Lohri
description: Festival marking the end of winter and the beginning of the harvest season.

name: Makar Sankranti
description: Festival celebrating the sun's northward journey into Capricorn.

name: Republic Day
description: Commemorates the adoption of the Constitution of India.

name: Vasant Panchami
description: Festival marking the arrival of spring and worship of Goddess Saraswati.

name: Maha Shivaratri
description: Night dedicated to Lord Shiva, observed with fasting and prayers.

name: Holi
description: Festival of colors celebrating the arrival of spring.

name: Ugadi
description: New Year's Day for the people of Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and Karnataka.

name: Ram Navami
description: Celebration of the birth of Lord Rama.

name: Mahavir Jayanti
description: Birth anniversary of Lord Mahavir, the 24th Tirthankara of Jainism.

name: Baisakhi
description: Harvest festival celebrated in Punjab and Haryana.

name: Buddha Purnima
description: Celebration of the birth, enlightenment, and death anniversary of Lord Buddha.

name: Eid al-Adha
description: Islamic festival commemorating the willingness of Ibrahim to sacrifice his son.

name: Muharram
description: Islamic New Year and remembrance of the martyrdom of Imam Hussain.

name: Independence Day
description: Commemorates India's independence from British rule in 1947.

name: Janmashtami
description: Celebration of the birth of Lord Krishna.

name: Ganesh Chaturthi
description: Festival celebrating the birth of Lord Ganesha.

name: Gandhi Jayanti
description: Birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi.

name: Dussehra
description: Celebration of the victory of good over evil, marking the end of Durga Puja.

name: Karva Chauth
description: Fasting ritual observed by married Hindu women for the well-being of their husbands.

name: Diwali
description: Festival of lights symbolizing the victory of light over darkness.

name: Govardhan Puja
description: Celebration of Lord Krishna's lifting of the Govardhan Hill.

name: Bhai Dooj
description: Celebration of the bond between brothers and sisters.

name: Chhath Puja
description: Worship of the Sun God observed in Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, and Jharkhand.

name: Guru Nanak Jayanti
description: Birth anniversary of Guru Nanak, the first Sikh Guru.

name: Christmas
description: Celebration of the birth of Jesus Christ.
